page.title: 11CLUNTON AREA:-FOREST & FARMS
page.content: FARMING. The main land use is for stock farming though all farmers grow some or all of the required feed in the form of hay, silage, roots and winter kale. Stock is a mixture of cattle and sheep. There is a small dairy herd in Clunton. Animals are marketed locally in Craven Arms, Ludlow, Knighton and even further afield in other market towns. FORESTRY. There is a large amount of woodland in the area which is mainly Forestry Commision land. PLANTING. Two year old trees are planted each year to maintain stock. WEEDING. After four years, trees are weeded using a brushing hook. They are then left 20 years until ready for thinning. FELLING. Mature firs are felled for export and home use.
